info.description: An API for evaluating the students upon many topics and subjects
info.title: Conselho API

get.description: Generates a new token and invalidates the current one.

User Token.description: With the user's email and password, the API generates a temporary token that needs to be sent with the header in every request.
User Token.name: Token

created_at.description: The time when the entity was inserted in the database.

input_error_messages.description: Detailed error messages for every input error
input_error_messages.example:
[
  "Name is required",
  "Email should be a valid email address"
]

denied_field.description: The input field that caused the permission error

active.description: If the evaluations needs to stop and the council needs to be hidden from teachers, it can be deactivated with this property.

name.description: A name that identifies the council.

start_date.description: The first day when the teachers can evaluate the students.

end_date.description: The last day when the teachers can evaluate the students.

created_at.description: The time when this council was inserted in the database.

updated_at.description: The last time when this council was updated in the database.

Council.description: Periodic events when the teachers evaluate the students.

Council Topic.description: Topics that will be evaluated in a council.

Evaluation.description: A single evaluation of a topic about a user.

Grade.description:
A group of students.

This entity could also be named as "Class", but it's a reserved word in many programming languages, so it was named like this to prevent errors and workarounds.

Grade Observation.description: A teacher's observation about a grade in a council.

Grade Subject.description: The subjects that a grade has lessons about.

Medical Report.description: When the student has a health issue that may justify some dificulties in some subject.

Medical Report Subject.description: The subjects that may be hard to the student because of the health issue.

Permission.description: The actions that a user can take in the system that may or not be allowed to do.

Role.description: The role that the user performs in the system to a school.

Role Type Permission.description: The actions that a role_type is allowed to do.

Student Grade.description: The grades that a user has gone through in a school.

Student Observation.description: Observations about a student made by a teacher in one council.

Teacher.description: Which user teaches which subject to which grade.

Topic.description: Topics and aspects of the students to be evaluated.

User Token.description: The token used to keep the user logged in the system without submitting the password in every request.

dvr87mp.title: Introduction and General Advices
dvr87mp.content:
In almost every request, it's required a user token. This token is obtained with the user's email and password.
There's only two requests allowed to be performed without a token: the user register (POST /user) and the log in (POST /user_token).

Every request needs to have the `Accept: application/json` header, unless it'll receive a `406 Unnaceptable` response.

Every request that sends data through the body needs to have the `Content-Type: application/json` header, unless it'll receive a `415 Unsupported Media Type` response. There's no problem in (and would probably be the best option) add this header in every request even the requests with no body data.

Every date needs to be in the `yyyy-mm-dd` format (like `2000-12-31`). 

Every date-time needs to be in the `RFC 3339` format (including timezone, like `2000-12-31T23:59:59+00:00`).

When the `Pretty-Output` header is found, with a true value, the output is prettified (indented and formated json). This is only useful in debugging and is not recomended to keep in production, since it would just increase the response size.

Date-time inputs are converted from the specified timezone (as of RFC 3339) to the UTC timezone before being stored in the database. When the `Timezone` header is found, with a valid timezone value (like `+03:00` or `-05:30`), the date-time outputs are converted from the stored UTC to the requested timezone. If no timezone is provided, the date-time outputs defaults to the UTC timezone.

81dliy4.title: Permissions
81dliy4.content:
The following permissions are set in the _permission_ resource and are used to control the actions that every user can take in the system.

| Name | Reference | Resources | Description |
| -------- | -------- | -------- | -------- |
| Gerenciar conselhos | council | council, council_grade, council_topic | Manage councils. |
| Avaliar alunos | evaluate | evaluation, grade_observation, student_observation, teacher_request, medical_report\* | Become a teacher and evaluate students. |
| Gerenciar turmas | grade | grade, grade_subject | Manage grades. |
| Gerenciar laudos | medical_report | medical_report, medical_report_subject | Manage medical reports. |
| Aceitar/negar permissões | role | role | Accept or deny role requests from other users |
| Gerenciar tipos de usuários | role_type | role_type, role_type_permission | Manage role types. |
| Gerenciar estudantes | student | student, student_grade | Manage students |
| Gerenciar matérias | subject | subject | Manage subjects |
| Gerenciar professores | teacher | teacher | Accept or deny teacher requests and create teachers |
| Tópicos | topic | topic, topic_option | Manage topics |
| Ver relatórios de conselhos | council_report | council\*\*, evaluation\*\*, student_observation\*\*, class_observation\*\* | Receber dados de conselhos não ativos |

_**Manage** means "create, edit and delete"; **\***: write only; **\*\***: read only._

wb9ms4i.title: Response Codes
wb9ms4i.content:
This API uses standard HTTP status codes to indicate the status of a response.

| Code | Name | Description |
| -------- | -------- | -------- |
| 200 | OK | Everything went fine in the request, and the return data is in the body of the response |
| 201 | Created | The resource was successfully created (same as 200 but for `POST` requests) |
| 204 | No Content | Everything went fine in the request, but there's no data to return |
| 400 | Bad Request | The request doesn't meet a specification of this documentation, so the server refuses to continue to proccess it |
| 401 | Unauthorized | The resource is only available upon login |
| 403 | Forbidden | The current user doesn't have permission to do this action |
| 404 | Not Found | The client is trying to apply some action to a specific resource, which was not found |
| 405 | Method Not Allowed | The client is trying to send a request to a resource with a invalid method |
| 406 | Not Acceptable | The client doesn't specify a `Accept` header, or it's value is not `application/json` |
| 415 | Unsupported Media Type | The client doesn't specify a `Content-Type` header, or it's value is not `application/json`. This is only required in the methods which actually uses the body data as input, but it's acceptable to define a `Content-Type` for all requests |
| 422 | Unprocessable Entity | Probably a malformed JSON input |
| 500 | Internal Server Error | A technical server error. This errors are logged in the server and are meant to be fixed by the server staff, not the client |
